docs.title: Adverse Outcome Pathway (AOP) Data Model
docs.text: This LinkML schema models Adverse Outcome Pathways (AOPs) - structured representations of biological pathways linking molecular initiating events to adverse outcomes at the organism or population level.

docs.title: What are AOPs?
docs.text: An Adverse Outcome Pathway describes a sequential chain of causally linked events at different biological levels that lead from a molecular initiating event (MIE) through intermediate key events (KEs) to an adverse outcome (AO). AOPs are used in toxicology, environmental health, and risk assessment to understand how chemical exposures or other stressors lead to adverse health effects.

docs.title: Schema Components
docs.text:
This data model captures:

  • Adverse Outcome Pathways: Complete pathways linking molecular initiating events to adverse outcomes
  • Key Events: Measurable biological changes at molecular, cellular, organ, or organism levels
  • Key Event Relationships: Directed associations between key events with supporting evidence
  • Measurement Processes: Detailed specifications of experimental methods, assays, and measurements used to assess key events
  • Scientific Evidence: Supporting data from peer-reviewed literature

docs.title: Context
docs.text:
This schema is part of the Source-to-Outcome (S2O) continuum framework, enabling standardized representation of biological pathway data for:

  • Environmental health and safety assessment
  • Toxicological pathway analysis
  • Risk assessment and regulatory decision-making
  • Integration with chemical exposure and epidemiological data

docs.title: Outcomes Data Model
docs.text:
A LinkML data model for representing biological measurements, assays, and experimental protocols in the context of outcomes research.

URI: https://w3id.org/EHS-Data-Standards/outcomes-model

Name: outcomes-model

docs.title: Classes
docs.text: Class Description NamedEntity Base class for all named entities in the model Assay The specific method or assay used to measure an endpoint BarrierIntegrity Epithelial barrier integrity measurements CellCultureConditions Detailed cell culture parameters CytotoxicityMetrics Cell viability and cytotoxicity measurements DetectionMethod Method used for detecting or measuring analytes EnvironmentalCondition Environmental parameters during measurement EvaporationControl Method used to prevent evaporation during measurement FluorescentLabel Fluorescent labeling or tracer used in measurement GeneExpressionAnalysis Gene expression measurement methodology ImagingProtocol Details about imaging parameters and protocols InflammatoryCellProfile Profile of inflammatory cell types and counts InputSample Description of the biological sample or experimental manipulation used as inp... Measurement A generic class representing the process of measuring a biological endpoint ASLHeightMeasurement Measurement of airway surface liquid height BALFSputumMeasurement Measurement of bronchoalveolar lavage fluid or sputum components CFTRFunctionMeasurement Measurement of CFTR-mediated ion transport function CiliaBeatFrequencyMeasurement Measurement of ciliary beat frequency EGFRSignalingMeasurement Measurement of EGFR pathway activation and signaling GobletCellMeasurement Measurement of goblet cell number or mucin production LungFunctionMeasurement Measurement of lung function parameters MucociliaryClearanceMeasurement Measurement of mucociliary clearance/transport OxidativeStressMeasurement Measurement of oxidative stress markers TranscriptionFactorExpressionMeasurement Measurement of transcription factor expression MicrobiomeAnalysis Microbiome composition analysis Publication Any published piece of information, following Biolink model ROSProbe Reactive oxygen species probe and detection details SampleCollection Details about biological sample collection StainingProtocol Histological or immunofluorescence staining protocol QuantityValue A quantity value expresses a measurement with a numeric value and a unit

BALFSputumMeasurement Measurement of bronchoalveolar lavage fluid or sputum components no CiliaBeatFrequencyMeasurement Measurement of ciliary beat frequency no LungFunctionMeasurement Measurement of lung function parameters no Measurement A generic class representing the process of measuring a biological endpoint no BarrierIntegrity Epithelial barrier integrity measurements no EGFRSignalingMeasurement Measurement of EGFR pathway activation and signaling no FluorescentLabel Fluorescent labeling or tracer used in measurement no GobletCellMeasurement Measurement of goblet cell number or mucin production no TranscriptionFactorExpressionMeasurement Measurement of transcription factor expression no NamedEntity Base class for all named entities in the model no SampleCollection Details about biological sample collection no CellCultureConditions Detailed cell culture parameters no EnvironmentalCondition Environmental parameters during measurement no ImagingProtocol Details about imaging parameters and protocols no InputSample Description of the biological sample or experimental manipulation used as inp... no DetectionMethod Method used for detecting or measuring analytes no ROSProbe Reactive oxygen species probe and detection details no MicrobiomeAnalysis Microbiome composition analysis no EvaporationControl Method used to prevent evaporation during measurement no Publication Any published piece of information, following Biolink model no ASLHeightMeasurement Measurement of airway surface liquid height no OxidativeStressMeasurement Measurement of oxidative stress markers no InflammatoryCellProfile Profile of inflammatory cell types and counts no Assay The specific method or assay used to measure an endpoint no MucociliaryClearanceMeasurement
